note.p: Birth: Newcastle upon Tyne, Northumberland, England (c 1790)

Career: Involved in management of Provincial Bank of Ireland, in London (1824); proposed a National Provincial Bank (1828); he was named as a director and originator when the plan was realised (1833); helped establish banks in Lancaster, Huddersfield, Bradford and Manchester; left the National Provincial Bank after a disagreement with fellow directors (1836); went to Bohmischdorf, Silesia, for his health, but died there
Notes: Note on certificate: 'Not elected Mar 26 1829'
